intro: Staurogyne alboviolacea subsp. grandiflora, commonly known as the white-violet staurogyne, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae, characterized by its aquatic or semi-aquatic growth habit. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for water gardens and ecological restoration projects.
